Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welcome children of the Scranton Industrial Park Community.

Quote.Speaker: Kids
Quote.Text: YAY!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Join your gangsta pumpkin on his palette truck of doom. Don't worry about a thing. Rest assured you will see me later. Bwah ha ha... [bumps into something] ... ha ha ha.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We are doing a haunted house this Halloween. Which is actually kinda spooky because, as legend has it, on this very site there used to be a productive paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to scare these kids so bad.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This is the spookiest warehouse in the world, kids. You don't believe me? Just take a look. [Kevin chops into Erin, who is dressed as Princess Fiona] Oh. Scary, huh? This is a surgery with an octopus and a burn victim.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Black widow.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Lulu from The Fifth Element.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nobody told me what people were, alright? So... label yourselves or take what you get.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I want to sell your blood!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's really not the trend in vampires right now.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Here is an old man and a goth dude... and then the old crone from Drag Me to Hell.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm a hobo.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I asked for a list. [Dwight rides in on a tricycle, laughing diabolically] ...and a clown.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm Jigsaw, idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're not as scary as Book Face, over there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. I am the popular social networking site known as Book Face.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ok, kids. You've all been so good and unbelievably patient so I think you are gonna get some candy!

Quote.Speaker: Kids
Quote.Text: Yeah! [a chair falls over, Michael is seen hanging from the ceiling with a noose around his neck - the kids scream]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kids, just remember, suicide is never the answer. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why is Christmas the only holiday that can have a message?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is the easy way out. You are not alone.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What the hell is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who wants candy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...and then I think I'm going to go to the Garlic Festival.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sounds like fun. You guys would love it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I bet we would.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They have a TCBY booth.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The same stuff you get downtown.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you like TCBY?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who doesn't?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't believe it's- I can't believe it's yogurt. Uh... it'll be fun

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I confirmed with Raskin Design and they're expecting the both of you in an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Actually, it's just gonna be me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: They said the both of you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is a mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You should give them a call. Check that out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Let's clear this up. [on phone] Well, there's actually been a few changes in the company and Michael and I are actually at the same level. So, I can- no. Nope. Why would that be a problem?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim's a good kid. He can handle a lot but sometimes you have to call in a master. I, uh... why would you date an amateur when you could date a professional?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. See ya' then.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wha- what?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: They said that they would feel more comfortable if you came along.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't they just want you to go by yourself? Why do they want me to come, too? I don't understand.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I absolutely don't understand, either.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't want you to feel like I'm baby-sitting you, or something. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let me get your stroller.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure. Michael's a good teacher. A teacher is someone who stands right next to you your whole life and never lets you do anything. That's what a teacher is, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you gonna call him?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. What is his name?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mr. Bourchard. They're very formal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. I've spoken to them on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well... this is not the phone. This is real life, baby, and you gotta own it. Is that what you are wearing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, it is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...and that is the watch that you are going to wear? No. It is not. You should wear this watch. I will loan it to you. It is a Tankard. I highly recommend you wear that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They are into style.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They are into appearance. We are selling success.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...and paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's sorta secondary. [offers Jim the watch again]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's trying to micro-co-manage me... or co-micro... manage... me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here we are outside-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: WB!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: - the Wilkes-Barre Industrial Park.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Industrial P.! Makin' cold calls.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The two people with the lowest sales in the quarter have to do them.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] Where are you? Dean Trophies. Suite 100. Sherman Blinds and Rugs. Suite 202.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here it is. [Andy is still singing] Suite 401.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. I was gonna sing that part.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. Now you don't have to.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Except it was going to resolve the melody, so now my head hurts. Feels like I held in a sneeze. Mmm! I hate this feeling. [sings] Suite 401.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Hi. Any messages?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're soaking wet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, well, Jim and I got caught in a little flash rain, flash wind, flash lightning.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Wow. Sounds scary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was. It was. And then in an instant it wasn't.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why isn't Jim wet?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I outran it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I don't think it rained. My hip would be throbbing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It rained.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, can I get you something? A towel? Some cocoa?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing. Cocoa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll just leave that suit in your office then.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: Must be nice to have company on these cold calls.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're kind of a dynamic duo. Or trio. [points to Pam's tummy]

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: How exciting! Do you guys know the sex yet?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Andy shakes his head 'no'] Oh. No, no. [laughing] We're not together. No, no, no. Definitely not. Definitely not. No. We just work together.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [miffed] Looks like somebody's got a case of the definitelies.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Michael is walking around in one of Jim's suits] Um, Michael? The custodian from Raskin Design is on the line. He said they found your keys in the Koi pond.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Did you say 'Koi pond'?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [phone rings] Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael, people are asking questions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Put them on speaker. Hey guys, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, did you you fall into a Koi pond?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... I can't really hear you. I think we have sort of a bad connection.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jim, did Michael fall into a Koi pond?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm... it's like Michael said. It was some- something else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was- Ok. This is what it was. It was these bunch of idiots who had put a fish tank in the ground with no cover and no railing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So you fell in?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Maybe I was trying to save a child that had fallen in.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So a child had fallen in?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not yet!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That is hilarious. [extends hand for a fist bump]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it is- don't! I'm not gonna bump. I'm not gonna bump. And it was not hilarious. It was very, very terrifying. [Stanley laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Truthfully, it wasn't the way he fell in. It was... how long it took him to get out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And we'd like to offer you 15% off your first purchase as our way of welcoming you to the area.

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: Well that sounds like a really nice deal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sha-bow.

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: And I must say, that since we are a family business it is nice to see that you are, too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. You thought that- oh, my gosh. Oh. Definitely not.

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: My mistake. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's ok.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nuh. Actually, it's kinda not ok. Um, I date models. Face models. My girlfriend, on a scale of one to Giselle, uh... a nine.

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: That- that's good for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Anyway, we also have a special on envelopes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pam's carrying our surrogate. Because my girlfriend needed to keep her figure for fashion week. So, we, uh, we put our baby in Pam. Doesn't matter what Pam looks like.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You were way meaner to me than I was to you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No I wasn't. Ok. The very idea of us together made you burst out laughing like you just bit into an Adam Sandler and jelly sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You blew the sale, you idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let me tell you something. I was never gonna make that sale.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Erin, do we have any of those clips that hold paper together?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Staples? [Kevin clears his throat] Uh, David Wallace called.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. He did? What did he say?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He heard you made a big splash at the meeting. Oh, my God. That was so mean what I just said and I didn't mean it. It was Kevin and Meredith put me up to it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [whispers to Erin] I'm gonna kill you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael, don't listen to them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You just ignore their carp.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A carp is both a fish and a term for complaing. They're mocking you with wordplay.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey, boss, did you find Nemo?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can name Pixar movies, too. Toy Story.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Don't you mean 'Koi Story'?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: And when you fell in, did you flounder?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, flounder is both a kind of fish and -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know what a flounder is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not usually the butt of the joke. I'm usually the face of the joke. I wish Jim had fallen into that pond and he'd have to put on my suit and it'd be too short and he'd look... Damn it! He'd still look good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The most fundamental thing about sensitivity training is that you cannot make fun of a person for something or some action that they have done that they regret. Show of hands- who has been 'Koi-ponded'? Who here's been the butt of a joke that has gone too far? Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, you make fun of us every day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Every single day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You never said anything.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Uh, we have. Countless times.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it is hard to tell the difference between you guys saying, 'Stop because I want you to stop' or STOP as in 'Stop. You're making me laugh so hard. What you're doing is so funny. You are on a roll. I am busting a gut. Stop!'

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That's never the case.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are going to make a 'Do Not Mock' list. Ok? Anything that we think might be out of bounds, we put on this list. Anything you put on this list you cannot be teased about. Got it? I'm gonna kick it off. Let's see what I have to put on the list, right? [writes 'Koi pond' on the list] Ok. I also have fallen into the fountain at the Steamtown Mall. Ok. Who else? Who else? Dwight, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't want people making fun of my nose.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your nose?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's too small.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh my. That is small.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just, write it down, please.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can you breathe okay?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What keeps your glasses on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey! It's on the list, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I haven't finished writing. Did you sneeze it off? That's it. No more. Ok. Who else? Who else? Everybody's getting their chance.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't want people making fun of my weight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. That's to broad. It's gotta be something else. How 'bout your stomach? Yeah? [writes Huge Gut] Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I don't want to say it out loud.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Fine. Come on up here. Write it yourself. And don't sign your name to it. And nobody look. Everybody look away. Look away.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I really didn't want to put it on the board but I thought maybe it was gonna come out somehow so... what are you gonna do? [she writes 'sex with a terrorist']

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is our sales pitch and we are stickin' to it.

Quote.Speaker: Keena Gifford
Quote.Text: Well, you two are quite the salesmen and a very cute couple.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh- [both look at each other and together say] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Keena Gifford
Quote.Text: Some couples don't seem like a good match. You two do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know. Two peas in a pod. We complete each other. What can I say? She loves to cook-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He loves to eat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I love to dance-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love to watch him dance.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right. Sometimes I'll just dance for hours in the living room-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And I'll just watch him.

Quote.Speaker: Keena Gifford
Quote.Text: And a baby on the way? You must be so excited.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. We are thrilled.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In fact, we spent the whole weekend researching various birthing coaches. Wasn't that fun, honey?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was, sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Keena Gifford
Quote.Text: Oh. I know the best teacher. Her name is Miss Janet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. On Clearview Avenue.

Quote.Speaker: Keena Gifford
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This sounds ridiculous, I know, but some people say that I eat like a squirrel.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So now you're comparing yourself to a cute, tiny animal?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Um, Michael? The custodian called again. Apparently a Koi has died. [everyone shows remorse]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a fish.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: They want you to pay for it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It could've died of natural causes. So...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, they said you stepped on it's head. He did not suffer.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: When is the funeral?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do not mock, Oscar. Do not mock. How much do they want?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? No. I could get a fish for a 5 cent worm.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh, you're payin' way too much for your worms, man. Who's your worm guy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok. Great meeting, everybody. That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. [everyone begins to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. We are not done here. This-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One of the baby books suggets the best birthing posture is on all fours, like an animal. I just wish I had a special telephone so I could find out exactly wht the little soy bean wants. Right? Hey, little soy bean. What do you want? Right. How do- It- I felt it kick!

Quote.Speaker: Keena Gifford
Quote.Text: That's great!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh. Like a little magical foot just high-fived me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, that'll happen.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh. It's like he's trying to say, 'I love you, too, Daddy'. I love you, too. [leans over and kisses Pam's belly]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes we're so excited we forget where we are. Like at a business meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Message received, little soy bean.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you just gotta ride this one out, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Jim. You don't understand. Things like this don't just die. Kids in high school still call me 'Ponytail'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, they don't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, they do, Jim. Because of the time I got my ponytail stuck in the power trail.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe if you make fun of yourself it'll all go away.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want to make fun of you right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? Do it. I am a big, stupid goofball.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Don't do that. You're not. You're not stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. I- I just wanna say that I cannot believe that I walked into a Koi pond. I mean, seriously. Walk much? [everyone starts laughing] Oh. I should wear a snorkel to the next business meeting that I go to.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael. You know, when you think about it, it's not all your fault. I mean, who puts a Koi pond in a lobby?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you know what? You're right, Phyllis, but I've been there before. I've seen that pond. This is the thing, I am a world class moron. That's the problem.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, please. Stop it now. You're embarrassing yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's ok. We're having fun. It's not actually the first time I've been embarrassed by a pond. In high school, the girls volleyball team always used to hrow me into the frozen lake. Four years in a row. Oh... it was freezing. [Jim signals for making to stop] No. No. No. Oh, this is even worse. [Michael begins to lose his cool] Couple weeks ago I went to get a new cellphone and I wanted on of those packages where you have, you know, the friends- the five- the friends and family thing and the guys was like, 'Who are your 5 friends?' and I'm, like, 'Uh... ' I didn't even know I couldn't even think. [realizing he's going downhill] Oh, my God. It was so embarrassing. That was- oh. I don't even have Jan's cell phone number and I hate her! She won't give it to me. I was like, 'Oh, I guess I'm a loser. 'A luh-whooooo a za her'. Too far! God! Thanks a lot, man. Thanks for the advice.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [watching Angela eat something] Enjoying your nut?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm not mocking. I was just making an observation about a nut.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I was.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Who wants to watch Michael's pond dive? My roommate's friend is the night janitor over there. He swiped the security tape for me and he's bringing it over.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm... I'm, know what? Maybe we should go easy on Michael, guys. You know, you watch that tape and you're gonna have to stay late for more sensitity training, so...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We'll stay late.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, that went pretty well.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We got a maybe. It was our first maybe. Going by the Nard Dog curve, I'd say we nailed it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If I'm being completely honest, I could've done without the belly kiss.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know what? I'm sorry. 'Cause in that moment I knew I was kissing your belly too much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Way too much.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, what the hell was that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What the heck was that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When you cried?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Agh- try almost cried, ok? I just got caught up in the fantasy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're fantsy involves comparison shopping birthing classes?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. I know I'm gonna go with Miss Janet. I just- I don't know. It was fun to role play, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, it was fun for me. Having a wife and a little baby. Agh, I'm so sick of being single.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, are you dating anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What do you think of Erin? I mean- she's- I- She's kinda cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You think I can do better?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gotta get my goin' out on.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, let's watch this thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Ok. Yeah. We're not watchin' this.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How can we not watch this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What happened to 'Do Not Mock'?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We're not mocking, we're watching.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That will inevitably lead to mocking. So...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, we'll deal with it as it comes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is this the tape of me falling?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes. Put the DVD in.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Open QuickTime.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It starts on it's own. Let it -

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No! Use QuickTime. Trust me. I've done this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Guys. Michael can't handle this and as your boss I'm saying we're not watching it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. It's ok. Watch it. He can't fire all of you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's alright. I can handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am a grown-up, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Shh. It's on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Here they come. [everyone reacts to seeing Michael fall in] Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh. Did - did you see that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See what?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why'd you stop it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oscar, yes. You're right to stop it. Thank you. Eject it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jim, you let Michael fall in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Play it again. [everyone has the same reaction as before] He purposefully leaned away and let you fall in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh... man. I thinke when I started to see you go in I think I just froze.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't think you froze.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a killer new dance move. [re-enacts leaning back] Do you wanna talk in your office?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't ask you. [back to Michael] Would you like to talk? [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Judas.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim is my enemy. But it turns out that Jim is also his own worst enemy. And the enemy of my enemy is my friend. So, Jim is actually my friend. But... because he is his own worst enemy, the enemy of my friend is my enemy. So, actually Jim is my enemy. But-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I should've grabbed you. I'm sorry. Look, I thought I could've done today's sales call alone. I mean, I may never be as good a salesman as you are, but I at least need the chance to do the job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim is jealous of me? Jim is jealous of me.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [as Jim enters the kitchen] Hey, what's up lifeguard?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jim, I think I'm in your way. [leans back - they both exit]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar's a douche.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughing] He's alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. He's a- yeah, he's alright. Ok. [holds door open as they exit]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome. Whoa! [leans back] Almost fell. [they both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Erin. Do you mind faxing this for me?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, sure. Oh, wait. Hand them to me upside down so I don't accidentally read them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How did today go, by the way? Did you make any sales?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. It was a total waste of time. Um... it was fun, though, because I got to spend the day with Andy Bernard. He's really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, he is!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, he is.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's, like, the coolest person I've ever met.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's... right. He's like Marlon Brando.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. Do you mean Marlon Wayans? 'Cause he is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I actually do mean Marlon Wayan. Yeah.
